text.title: Comfortably Sleep with a Dog in Your Bed
text.head: Comfortably Sleep with a Dog in Your Bed
text.p: Sometimes you want your furry companion to share a sleep space but you get ca n't seem to really fit together and sleep comfortably . Use these tips and you and your fuzzy pal will be cuddling comfortably all night long !
text.head: Steps

list.item: Make sure that your dog will sleep in your bed . Some dogs do n't like to sleep with their owners and that 's perfectly fine . If they do n't want then just let it go for a while and maybe try again later . Make sure that you do n't force anything . If your dog usually sleeps somewhere that that is not your bed do n't be surprised if your dog jumps off and goes back there in the middle of the night . Make sure that your dog can easily get up and down off your bed or you will get very tired very quickly of putting them up there every time . Know that in the wild , dogs tend to find a place to sleep and call it 's den for a very long time so do n't be surprised if your dog wants to stay there . If your dog is having trouble try moving their crate , pillow or whatever else they sleep on into your room for a while so they get used to sleeping in that room

Have a couple trial nights . Have a couple of nights where you try to sleep with your dog to see some of the patterns the dogs do . Do they like to sleep at the top of the bed ? Do they move or bark a lot in their sleep ? Do they tend to lick their paws or pant a lot before going to sleep ? Make sure that you pick a pretty open week to do this where you do n't have to worry about being tired the next day if your dog kept you up all night .

Fix any patterns that you do n't like . Now you need to fix any problem that you come across . If your dog has a tendency to do something in bed that you do n't like now is the time to fix it . If your dog tends to sleep somewhere that you find difficult to lay down comfortably try moving them to your preferred spot before you go you sleep . If they lick their paws a lot , pant , spin in circles , or something else like that before they go to sleep try to get into bed earlier so they can do that before you need to sleep .

And you are done ! Your fluffy friend and you should have no problem sleeping together . hope you enjoyed this article it is my first one . I have slept with my two dogs for four years now so I have picked up a few tips over the years . Thank You !

text.head: Tips

list.item: Having a nice big bed helps a lot . I used to sleep with my two dogs on a twin sized mattress and it did n't really work . But I 've since then gotten a queen and it is much better .
If your dog tends to be a blanket hogger get them another blanket that they can sleep on so you can have yours all to your self .
If your dog is keeping you up because they keep walking around and moving try taking them for a walk or playing fetch before bed to try to wear them out .

Do n't be afraid to move them if they are laying somewhere or doing something that you do n't like . It does n't make them not love you any more or anything so just do it and get it over with and then you will be much more comfortable
